org.apereo.cas.util.cipher

Class BaseStringCipherExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apereo.cas.util.cipher.AbstractCipherExecutor<java.io.Serializable,java.lang.String>
      • org.apereo.cas.util.cipher.BaseStringCipherExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apereo.cas.CipherExecutor<java.io.Serializable,java.lang.String>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProtocolTicketCipherExecutor, TicketGrantingCookieCipherExecutor

    public abstract class BaseStringCipherExecutor
extends AbstractCipherExecutor<java.io.Serializable,java.lang.String>
    The BaseStringCipherExecutor is the default implementation of CipherExecutor. It provides a facade API to encrypt, sign, and verify values.
    Since:
    4.1

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseStringCipherExecutor

        public BaseStringCipherExecutor(java.lang.String secretKeyEncryption,
                                java.lang.String secretKeySigning)
        Instantiates a new cipher.

        Note that in order to customize the encryption algorithms, you will need to download and install the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy File into your Java installation.

        Parameters:
        secretKeyEncryption - the secret key encryption; must be represented as a octet sequence JSON Web Key (JWK)
        secretKeySigning - the secret key signing; must be represented as a octet sequence JSON Web Key (JWK)

      • BaseStringCipherExecutor

        public BaseStringCipherExecutor(java.lang.String secretKeyEncryption,
                                java.lang.String secretKeySigning,
                                java.lang.String contentEncryptionAlgorithmIdentifier)
        Instantiates a new cipher.
        Parameters:
        secretKeyEncryption - the key for encryption
        secretKeySigning - the key for signing
        contentEncryptionAlgorithmIdentifier - the content encryption algorithm identifier
